content:
For those who don't know, we're just ending session 1 of the two-day course by David Hay, "HL7 FHIR for Clinicians, Managers and Executives" ... there will be homework, and attendees have been invited to discuss here.

Course participants: the thing that stymied me about this app is that I couldn't find a button or link in the Streams list to start a new thread! I was looking in the wrong place - at bottom of screen it's in pale pale PALE gray (I hate vague UI!) - look for this: pasted image
Thnaks Dave...
@David Hay I hope someone will be emailing us the link to the homework itself, because so much happened so fast that I have no clue where it is. :-)
The slides are in the preso - slides 33 & 34 - was that what you were after?

TRULY excellent presentation, btw. I mean EXCELLENT in all caps. We MUST MUST MUST get an "e-patient" version of this into the public's hands as soon as practical - I know patients who will drool at the chance to get ready to do FHIR work asap because their lives depend daily on it.
That's high praise, David.
Indeed - many thanks dave...

BTW - some links to info about conman: (should be reasonably up to date)...
https://fhirblog.com/participating-in-a-clinical-connectathon/
https://fhirblog.com/tips-and-tricks-for-the-conman-scenario-builder/

@David Hay For me at least, the links on both slides are not clickable. Hey, I'll paste in here.

The ConMan URL: http://conman.clinfhir.com/connectathon.html?event=hl7Webinar <==W is case sensitive!

Use ConMan to create the data for the cases on slides 33 & 34 in the PDF you were sent today.

(David, I can't copy/paste the text from those slides - can you?)
btw, though I've been a registered chat user since November, I was unable to find clinfhir in the sidebar, so it may be useful to email everyone a short cheat-sheet on how to do it. Gotta run now -

Exercise 1: Medication list

http://conman.clinfhir.com/connectathon.html?event=hl7Webinar
Create a simple medication list for a patient who is taking Atenolol 50mg / day and furosemide 20mg in the morning
Track: Build medication list

Exercise 2: Consultation

Ned Little is a 5 year old boy presenting to his primary practitioner with a 3 day history of right ear pain and a high temperature. On examination a diagnosis of Otitis Media is made and he is started on a course of Amoxycillin
Track: Ambulatory Care encounter

(see slides 25 & 26 for inspiration!) - and remember that in conman, when you're building a graph there are a number of resources already set up in the palette (that's done when you define the scenario) but you can add any other resource by clicking the >Select Direct< link...

Feel free to make any comments - whether about usability, suggested updates or scenarios that could be of interest...

Is this chat site open to the public, including people who weren't on the webinar today? Particularly, if CONMAN is open to all visitors, could my more-engaged / more-technical patient friends start diving in and exploring?
sure - no issues. It's all public...
No guarantee that any work will remain though. Would need to set up a separate event if you wanted that...
My intention would just be to see if certain people started drooling :-) .... but first things first: gotta do MY homework. Now, to scroll back...

@David Hay I clearly missed part of your demonstration today because now that I'm in CONMAN, I have no clue where to start. Is a replay of the session available? Or can you point me / us to what I missed as first steps?

I know to select the track Build a Medication List. I think. Completely lost!

So:

Log in
select the 'build a medication list' track from the left side
select the 'graph builder' tab at the top
start selecting resources and hooking them together

I may have done a video - let me go look...

Happy to do another session (in fact we'll do a review tomorrow) ...

@Dave deBronkart - here's a video I did a little while back: https://vimeo.com/263774117

hope that all helps!

@David Hay Are you able to see what I'm doing? I appear to be suffering from way too few guardrails and/or way too little instruction.

Going off to watch your 12 minute Vimeo now, in hope of salvation...

I'm a few minutes into the video. Preliminary feedback for other pilgrims:
- It DEFINITELY helps re what to ignore
- But a lot's changed since this May recording - e.g. "Scenario builder" seems to now be Graph Builder. (The latter seems a lot less clear, to me - but I don't yet know how to make it work)

Edits as more thoughts arise -

yes - quite a lot has changed I'm afraid...

Maybe I better record a new one...

Still, it's a terrific improvement in orientation. Now to see if I can execute this thing :slight_smile:

btw in the video I kept noticing your shrinking Battery Remaining indicator and trying to plug MY Mac in. Did not work. A little too Matrixy for comfort. :slight_smile:

I love the matrix!

btw - you seem to be progressing now! once you've added the MedicationStatements, add a List resource and then references from List.entry.item to the MedicationStatements. (Don't forget to click the + symbol against entry to create a new entry - you'll need one entry per resource that you're referencing...

I think I've created something that resembles your video. But along the way I created demented extra things that I don't know how to delete. For instance, I created a Medication(x) for no reason.

I'll see what I can figure out by poking around in Hide Without Data.
Look, teacher - I think I did it! Is this right? pasted image
Go to the top of the class! Now, try adding some coded data to the resources - eg the patients name, gender and birthdate...
I will first work on exercise 2 ...
Oh - you did the dosage in the meds - well done!
perhaps you can do the 'how to' video :)
And did you find my snarky instructions to the slacker patient for each med?
Perhaps you can take a hike in New Zealand's legendary mountains :-) :-)
"Take 20 mg in morning. No complaining, just do it." ? Now you're sounding like an old-school doc....
Consider it an Easter egg for you, sensei.
